title: Borshchiv Raion
text:
Borshchiv Raion (, <a href="Romanization%20of%20Ukrainian">translit.</a> "Borschivs’kyi raion") was a <a href="raion">raion</a> (a <a href="district">district</a> within <a href="Ternopil%20Oblast">Ternopil Oblast</a> (<a href="oblast">province</a>) in western <a href="Ukraine">Ukraine</a>, an area known as <a href="Galicia%20%28Central%20Europe%29">Galicia</a>. The <a href="Capital%20%28political%29">administrative center</a> of the raion was <a href="Borshchiv">Borshchiv</a>. The raion was abolished on 18 July 2020 as part of the administrative reform of Ukraine, which reduced the number of raions of Ternopil Oblast to three. The area of Borshchiv Raion was merged into <a href="Chortkiv%20Raion">Chortkiv Raion</a>. The last estimate of the raion population was 
Subdivisions.
At the time of disestablishment, the raion consisted of five <a href="hromada">hromada</a>s:
Demographics.
In 2020, the district's population was . Of this, 19,621 were urban inhabitants (mostly concentrated in Borshchiv).
Geography.
The territory of Borshchiv raion was 1,006 square kilometers (100,600 hectares).
Villages.
There were 70 villages ("selo") within the raion, 2 <a href="urban-type%20settlement">urban-type settlement</a>s and one city ("misto") - Borshchiv. The major villages in Borshchiv district included:
Names are given in <a href="Ukrainian%20language">Ukrainian</a> followed by <a href="Polish%20language">Polish</a> and <a href="Russian%20language">Russian</a> names in brackets. Some of the villages listed below (those located to the southeast of Borshchiv), belonged administratively to the bordering <a href="Zalishchyky%20Raion">Zalishchyky Raion</a>.
